chapter.title: Roles
chapter.para: The rel="roles" link obtained from the entry point URI (see ) provides access to a static set of system roles. Each individual role elements contain the following:

note.title: Element property icons
note.para: The icons used in the properties column of this table are described in

row.entry: Globally unique identifier for this role
The role name (may be used as a more convenient identifier in any role-specific operations)
A free-text description of the role
A reference to the associated user (only present in the context of the role represented being assigned to an individual user)

chapter.screen:
GET /rhevm-api/roles HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/xml
HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Type: application/xml
<roles> <role id="00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001" href="/rhevm-api/roles/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001"> <name>SuperUser</name> <description>Roles management administrator</description> </role> <role id="00000000-0000-0000-0001-000000000001" href="/rhevm-api/roles/00000000-0000-0000-0001-000000000001"> <name>RHEVMUser</name> <description>RHEVM user</description> </role> <role id="00000000-0000-0000-0001-000000000002" href="/rhevm-api/roles/00000000-0000-0000-0001-000000000002"> <name>RHEVMPowerUser</name> <description>RHEVM power user</description> </role> <role id="00000000-0000-0000-0001-000000000003" href="/rhevm-api/roles/00000000-0000-0000-0001-000000000003"> <name>RHEVMVDIUser</name> <description>RHEVM VDI user</description> </role> </roles>

note.para: Because the global roles form a static set in Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization Manager 2.2, the usual collection idioms are not followed in this case, i.e. a new role cannot be created via POST, nor can a role be destroyed via DELETE on the collection.

section.title: Permits Sub-Collection
section.para: Each role contains a set of allowable actions, or permits, which are defined in . A role's permits are listed as a sub-collection:
section.screen:
GET /rhevm-api/roles/b67dfbe2-0dbc-41e4-86d3-a2fbef02cfa9/permits HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/xml
HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Type: application/xml
<permits> <permit id="1" href="/rhevm-api/roles/b67dfbe2-0dbc-41e4-86d3-a2fbef02cfa9/permits/1"> <name>CREATE_VM</name> <administrative>false</administrative> <role id="b67dfbe2-0dbc-41e4-86d3-a2fbef02cfa9" href="/rhevm-api/roles/b67dfbe2-0dbc-41e4-86d3-a2fbef02cfa9"/> </permit> <permit id="4" href="/rhevm-api/roles/b67dfbe2-0dbc-41e4-86d3-a2fbef02cfa9/permits/4"> <name>VM_BASIC_OPERATIONS</name> <administrative>false</administrative> <role id="b67dfbe2-0dbc-41e4-86d3-a2fbef02cfa9" href="/rhevm-api/roles/b67dfbe2-0dbc-41e4-86d3-a2fbef02cfa9"/> </permit> </permits>
section.para: A permit is assigned to a role when POSTed to the permits sub-collection. Use either an id= attribute or a name element to specify the permit to assign. For example:
section.screen:
POST /rhevm-api/roles/b67dfbe2-0dbc-41e4-86d3-a2fbef02cfa9/permits HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/xml
<permit id="1"/>
HTTP/1.1 201 Created Content-Type: application/xml
<permits> <permit id="1" href="/rhevm-api/roles/b67dfbe2-0dbc-41e4-86d3-a2fbef02cfa9/permits/1"> <name>CREATE_VM</name> <administrative>false</administrative> <role id="b67dfbe2-0dbc-41e4-86d3-a2fbef02cfa9" href="/rhevm-api/roles/b67dfbe2-0dbc-41e4-86d3-a2fbef02cfa9"/> </permit> </permits>
